parallel

Class SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator

  • public class SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator
extends java.lang.Object
    The SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator class: yet another class that allows sending and receiving (synchronous and asynchronous) data between threads. It behaves as the SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator, except that tasks are assumed to have different priorities, and higher-priority tasks are received before lower-priority ones. The class is used e.g. with the FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

      • sendData

        public void sendData(ComparableTaskObject data)
              throws ParallelException
        stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is. The method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        data - ComparableTaskObject
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if there are more data than _maxSize in the queue

      • sendDataBlocking

        public void sendDataBlocking(ComparableTaskObject data)
        stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is. The method will wait if the queue is full until another thread consumes a datum and allows this thread to write to the _data buffer.
        Parameters:
        data - Object

      • recvData

        public java.lang.Object recvData()
        retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call (from another thread) to sendData(threadId, data). If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until another thread stores an appropriate datum.
        Returns:
        Object
